org.apache.juneau.html

Class HtmlDocSerializerContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.Context
      • org.apache.juneau.BeanContext
        • org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerContext
          • org.apache.juneau.xml.XmlSerializerContext
            • org.apache.juneau.html.HtmlSerializerContext
              • org.apache.juneau.html.HtmlDocSerializerContext

  • public final class HtmlDocSerializerContext
extends HtmlSerializerContext
    Properties associated with the HtmlDocSerializer class.

    These are typically specified via @RestResource.properties() and @RestMethod.properties() annotations, although they can also be set programmatically via the RestResponse.setProperty() method.

    Example:

    @RestResource( messages="nls/AddressBookResource", properties={ @Property(name=HtmlDocSerializerContext.HTMLDOC_title, value="$L{title}"), @Property(name=HtmlDocSerializerContext.HTMLDOC_description, value="$L{description}"), @Property(name=HtmlDocSerializerContext.HTMLDOC_links, value="{options:'?method=OPTIONS',doc:'doc'}") } ) public class AddressBookResource extends RestServletJenaDefault {

    Note that shortcut annotations are also provided for these particular settings:

    @RestResource( messages="nls/AddressBookResource", title="$L{title}", // or pageTitle description="$L{description}", // or pageText pageLinks="{options:'?method=OPTIONS',doc:'doc'}" ) public class AddressBookResource extends RestServletJenaDefault {

    The $L{...} variable represent localized strings pulled from the resource bundle identified by the messages annotation. These variables are replaced at runtime based on the HTTP request locale. Several built-in runtime variable types are defined, and the API can be extended to include user-defined variables.

    Inherited configurable properties:
    • BeanContext - Properties associated with handling beans on serializers and parsers.
      • SerializerContext - Configurable properties common to all serializers.
        • HtmlSerializerContext - Configurable properties on the HTML serializer.

    • Field Detail

      • HTMLDOC_title

        public static final String HTMLDOC_title
        Configuration property: Page title.

        • Name: "HtmlSerializer.title"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: null
        • Session-overridable: true

        Example:

        The AddressBookResource sample class uses this property...

        @RestResource( messages="nls/AddressBookResource", properties={ @Property(name=HtmlDocSerializerContext.HTMLDOC_title, value="$L{title}") } ) public class AddressBookResource extends RestServletJenaDefault {

        ...with this property in AddressBookResource.properties...

        title = AddressBook sample resource

        ...to produce this title on the HTML page...

        Shortcuts on @RestResource are also provided for this setting:

        @RestResource( messages="nls/AddressBookResource", title="My title", // or pageTitle ) public class AddressBookResource extends RestServletJenaDefault {

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTMLDOC_text

        public static final String HTMLDOC_text
        Configuration property: Page description.

        • Name: "HtmlSerializer.description"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: null
        • Session-overridable: true

        Example:

        The AddressBookResource sample class uses this property...

        @RestResource( messages="nls/AddressBookResource", properties={ @Property(name=HtmlDocSerializerContext.HTMLDOC_description, value="My description") } ) public class AddressBookResource extends RestServletJenaDefault {

        ...with this property in AddressBookResource.properties...

        description = Simple address book POJO sample resource

        ...to produce this description on the HTML page...

        Shortcuts on @RestResource are also provided for this setting:

        @RestResource( messages="nls/AddressBookResource", description="My description", // or pageText ) public class AddressBookResource extends RestServletJenaDefault {

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTMLDOC_links

        public static final String HTMLDOC_links
        Configuration property: Page links.

        • Name: "HtmlDocSerializer.links.map"
        • Data type: Map<String,String>
        • Default: empty map
        • Session-overridable: true

        Adds a list of hyperlinks immediately under the title and description but above the content of the page.

        This can be used to provide convenient hyperlinks when viewing the REST interface from a browser.

        The value is a JSON object string where the keys are anchor text and the values are URLs.

        Relative URLs are considered relative to the servlet path. For example, if the servlet path is "http://localhost/myContext/myServlet", and the URL is "foo", the link becomes "http://localhost/myContext/myServlet/foo". Absolute ("/myOtherContext/foo") and fully-qualified ("http://localhost2/foo") URLs can also be used.

        Example:

        The AddressBookResource sample class uses this property...

        @RestResource( messages="nls/AddressBookResource", properties={ @Property(name=HtmlDocSerializerContext.HTMLDOC_links, value="{options:'?method=OPTIONS',doc:'doc'}") } ) public class AddressBookResource extends RestServletJenaDefault {

        ...to produce this list of links on the HTML page...

        A shortcut on @RestResource is also provided for this setting:

        @RestResource( messages="nls/AddressBookResource", pageLinks="{options:'?method=OPTIONS',doc:'doc'}" ) public class AddressBookResource extends RestServletJenaDefault {

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final String HTMLDOC_links_put
        Configuration property: Add to the HTMLDOC_links property.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTMLDOC_cssUrl

        public static final String HTMLDOC_cssUrl
        Configuration property: Stylesheet URL.

        • Name: "HtmlDocSerializer.cssUrl"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "style.css"
        • Session-overridable: true

        Adds a link to the specified stylesheet URL.

        If not specified, defaults to the built-in stylesheet located at "style.css". Note that this stylesheet is controlled by the @RestResource.stylesheet() annotation.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTMLDOC_cssImports

        public static final String HTMLDOC_cssImports
        Configuration property: CSS imports.

        • Name: "HtmlDocSerializer.cssImports.list"
        • Data type: List<String>
        • Default: empty list
        • Session-overridable: true

        Imports the specified CSS page URLs into the page.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTMLDOC_cssImports_add

        public static final String HTMLDOC_cssImports_add
        Configuration property: Add to the HTMLDOC_cssImports property.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HTMLDOC_nowrap

        public static final String HTMLDOC_nowrap
        Configuration property: Prevent word wrap on page.

        • Name: "HtmlDocSerializer.nowrap"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Session-overridable: true

        Adds "* {white-space:nowrap}" to the style header to prevent word wrapping.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
